benchmark_details.name: StableToolBench
benchmark_details.overview: StableToolBench is a newly proposed benchmark designed to enhance the stability of evaluations in tool learning for Large Language Models (LLMs) by incorporating a virtual API system and stable evaluation methods.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of StableToolBench is to provide a stable and scalable evaluation framework for assessing LLMs' capabilities in utilizing external tools.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation framework relies on GPT-4 as the automatic evaluator, which may increase costs.

data.source: Generated from the virtual API system and simulated environments.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of LLMs against evaluated tasks categorized as solvable or unsolvable.
methodology.interpretation: Higher SoPR and SoWR indicate better tool utilization capabilities of LLMs.
methodology.validation: Evaluation procedures are conducted with multiple model runs and analyzed for consistency.
